text: Mark Whitty Everson (born September 10, 1954) is an American politician. He served as the 46th Commissioner of Internal Revenue from 2003 until 2007. On March 5, 2015, Everson announced his intention to seek the Republican Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2016 Presidential election. He launched his bid with a video and sixteen page open letter in which he laid out six primary issues. He withdrew from the race on November 5, 2015. ==References== Category:2016 United States presidential candidates Category:1954 births Category:Living people Category:Yale University alumni Category:New York University alumni Category:Commissioners of Internal Revenue Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Mark Everson
